comment.text:
Working for me

karma: +1
wfm - desktop 32GB Intel i7-4770 CPU and laptop 16GB Intel i7-3610QM CPU
Works for me, x86_64 work station.

Works for me, x86_64 work station.

karma: +1
No regressions noted.
The problem with the ds2490 still exists https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1415397
The problem with the ds2490 still exists https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1415397
works fine here (Clevo W35xx)
WFM, Thinkpad X250

- Works great on my Thinkpad X220.
- Kernel regression tests passed.
testing F25 for Cubietruck; everything good so far except wifi. It's not working due to a missing kernel module "pwrseq_simple". Any chance to add this module to the out-of-the-box kernel?

-negative karma  fpaste --sysinfo https://paste.fedoraproject.org/538708/37171148

video doesnt support full resolution and external monitor not found
Works on T450s, Atom based server and a VM, all x86_64. Dunno yet whether that suspend bug with e1000e was fixed on T450s, but it's no worse than 4.9.5.
No regressions on my laptop with AMD E-450 APU
Works for me
Please be aware of the following bugs: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1415339 https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1391987

As an addendum to my earlier karma: I've actually been experiencing intermittent problems where one of my laptops (a Lenovo ThinkPad Edge E531) fails to resume from suspension. This started with the 4.9 kernel series, but I haven't narrowed it down to which one (but it definitely predates 4.9.6). I don't have anything useful to report since the journal records the system suspending and then nothing else. It's not a graphics issue, as the machine fails to respond to pings as well. It appears that it actually fails to completely suspend (USB devices cease to receive power, the screen blanks, the fan turns off, etc., but the power indicator light never starts blinking), and gets stuck in a state it can't get out of. I haven't seen any bug reports that match these particular parameters.
Working fine for me.

This kernel does not fix RHBZ#1415339 (Problem with realtek driver).

Passed kernel regression test on x86_64 machine
And... machine doesn't shutdown properly.

Yeah, I'm also seeing the shutdown problem on a desktop i3 with bios. But not a regression with 4.9.6 for me.
Looks to me, like fixing a similar issue with 4.9 broke other machines, as mine worked fine with 4.8:
https://bugzilla.kernel.org/show_bug.cgi?id=187061

the error ----> [    3.852338] tpm_crb MSFT0101:00: can't request region for resource [mem 0xfed40080-0xfed40fff]

stills persists on the kernel. 
The brightness keys function are now disabled too.
Machine : Asus UX303UA

the error ----> [ 3.852338] tpm_crb MSFT0101:00: can't request region for resource [mem 0xfed40080-0xfed40fff]
stills persists on the kernel. The brightness keys function are now disabled too. Machine : Asus UX303UA

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:

GRE over IPv6 is not enabled in the kernel:

  $ grep -H CONFIG_IPV6_GRE /boot/config-`uname -r`
  /boot/config-4.8.13-300.fc25.x86_64:# CONFIG_IPV6_GRE is not set

Hence this kind of tunnel cannot be used.

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):

kernel-4.8.13-300.fc25.x86_64

How reproducible:

Always

Steps to Reproduce:

Attempt to create a GRE over IPv6 tunnel using iproute2:

  # ip -6 tu add tun0 mode ip6gre local fd00::1 remote fd00::2

Actual results:

tun0 device doesn't get created. 'ip' command exits with an error status (1) and complains about missing fallback device ip6gre0:

  add tunnel "ip6gre0" failed: No such device

Expected results:

'ip' command succeeds, exit status 0. tun0 device gets created:

  # ip link show tun0
  6: tun0@NONE: <POINTOPOINT,NOARP> mtu 1448 qdisc noop state DOWN mode DEFAULT qlen 1
      link/[823] fd:00:00:00:00:00:00:00:00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01 peer fd:00:00:00:00:00:00:00:00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01

Additional info:

This config option is enabled in RHEL7. We would like to test the same functionality on Fedora kernels.
This has been enabled in 4.10-rc4-git one for rawhide.
kernel-4.9.6-200.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-81fbd592d4
kernel-4.9.6-100.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-6cc158c193

kernel-4.9.6-100.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for
instructions on how to install test updates.
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-6cc158c193

kernel-4.9.6-200.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for
instructions on how to install test updates.
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-81fbd592d4
kernel-4.9.6-200.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
kernel-4.9.6-200.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
kernel-4.9.6-100.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: CVE-2017-5547 kernel: DMA buffers on stack

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-5547 kernel: DMA buffers on stack

long_desc.thetext:
A possible DoS issue in HID corsair was found.

Upstream patch:

https://git.kernel.org/cgit/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=6d104af38b570d37aa32a5803b04c354f8ed513d

CVE assignment:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2017/q1/161

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1416128]

Statement:

This issue does not affect the Linux kernel packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, 6, 7 and MRG-2 as the code with the flaw is not present in the products listed.

bugs.title: CVE-2016-10153 kernel: introduce ceph_crypt() for in-place en/decryption

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2016-10153 kernel: introduce ceph_crypt() for in-place en/decryption

long_desc.thetext:
A possible DoS kernel issue was found in libceph affecting kernels with VMAP_STACK enabled.

Upstream patch:

https://git.kernel.org/cgit/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=a45f795c65b479b4ba107b6ccde29b896d51ee98

CVE assignment:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2017/q1/161

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1416128]

bugs.title: CVE-2017-5548 kernel: Using stack for buffers in ieee802154

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-5548 kernel: Using stack for buffers in ieee802154

long_desc.thetext:
A possible DoS issue was found in ieee802154/atusb.c when using stack for buffers. This issue affects kernel >= 4.9.

Upstream fix:

https://git.kernel.org/cgit/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=05a974efa4bdf6e2a150e3f27dc6fcf0a9ad5655

CVE assignment:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2017/q1/161

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1416128]

bugs.title: CVE-2017-5551 kernel: S_ISGD is not cleared when setting posix ACLs in tmpfs (CVE-2016-7097 incomplete fix)

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-5551 kernel: S_ISGD is not cleared when setting posix ACLs in tmpfs (CVE-2016-7097 incomplete fix)

long_desc.thetext:
It was found that fix for CVE-2016-7097 was incomplete as it missed tmpfs.

Upstream patch:

https://git.kernel.org/cgit/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=497de07d89c1410d76a15bec2bb41f24a2a89f31

CVE assignment:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2017/q1/161

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1416128]
[disregard]

Statement:

This issue affects the Linux kernel packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5. This has been rated as having Moderate security impact and is not currently planned to be addressed in future updates. For additional information, refer to the Red Hat Enterprise Linux Life Cycle: https://access.redhat.com/support/policy/updates/errata/.

This issue affects the Linux kernel packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6, 7 and MRG-2. Future Linux kernel updates for the respective releases might address this issue.

This flaw was fixed in the Red Hat products as a part of the CVE-2016-7097 fix.

Notes:

This flaw was fixed in the Red Hat products as a part of the CVE-2016-7097 fix:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1368938

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2016-10153 kernel: introduce ceph_crypt() for in-place en/decryption

long_desc.thetext:
A possible DoS kernel issue was found in libceph affecting kernels with VMAP_STACK enabled.

Upstream patch:

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2016-10154 kernel: smbencrypt() points a scatterlist to the stack causing DoS

long_desc.thetext:
A possible DoS issue was found in cifs/smbencrypt.c when smbencrypt() points a scatterlist to the stack. This affects only kernels with CONFIG_VMAP_STACK enabled.

Upstream patch:

https://git.kernel.org/cgit/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=06deeec77a5a689cc94b21a8a91a76e42176685d

CVE assignment:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2017/q1/161

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1416128]
This was fixed in the 4.9.1 stable kernels and is currently on all supported Fedora releases.

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-5548 kernel: Using stack for buffers in ieee802154

long_desc.thetext:
A possible DoS issue was found in ieee802154/atusb.c when using stack for buffers. This issue affects kernel >= 4.9.

Upstream fix:

https://git.kernel.org/cgit/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=05a974efa4bdf6e2a150e3f27dc6fcf0a9ad5655

CVE assignment:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2017/q1/161

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1416128]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-5549 kernel: Incorrect line-state error handling

long_desc.thetext:
It was found that current implementation of kl5kusb105 driver failed to detect short transfers when attempting to read the line state and logged the content of the uninitialised heap transfer buffer.

Upstream patch:

https://git.kernel.org/cgit/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=146cc8a17a3b4996f6805ee5c080e7101277c410

CVE assignment:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2017/q1/161

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1416128]
This issue was fixed with the 4.9.5 stable release, currently available on all supported Fedora releases.

Statement:

This issue affects the Linux kernel packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, 6, 7 and MRG-2. This has been rated as having Low security impact and is not currently planned to be addressed in future updates. For additional information, refer to the Red Hat Enterprise Linux Life Cycle: https://access.redhat.com/support/policy/updates/errata/.

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-5550 kernel: Information leak due to fencepost error in pipe_advance()

long_desc.thetext:
A heap infoleak due to fencepost error in pipe_advance() was found.

Upstream patch:

https://git.kernel.org/cgit/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=b9dc6f65bc5e232d1c05fe34b5daadc7e8bbf1fb

CVE assignment:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2017/q1/161

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1416128]
This issue was fixed with the 4.9.5 stable release, currently available on all supported Fedora releases.

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-5551 kernel: S_ISGD is not cleared when setting posix ACLs in tmpfs (CVE-2016-7097 incomplete fix)

long_desc.thetext:
It was found that fix for CVE-2016-7097 was incomplete as it missed tmpfs.

Upstream patch:

https://git.kernel.org/cgit/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=497de07d89c1410d76a15bec2bb41f24a2a89f31

CVE assignment:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2017/q1/161

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1416128]
[disregard]

Statement:

This issue affects the Linux kernel packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5. This has been rated as having Moderate security impact and is not currently planned to be addressed in future updates. For additional information, refer to the Red Hat Enterprise Linux Life Cycle: https://access.redhat.com/support/policy/updates/errata/.

This issue affects the Linux kernel packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6, 7 and MRG-2. Future Linux kernel updates for the respective releases might address this issue.

This flaw was fixed in the Red Hat products as a part of the CVE-2016-7097 fix.

Notes:

This flaw was fixed in the Red Hat products as a part of the CVE-2016-7097 fix:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1368938

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of Fedora.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Reproducers, if any, will remain confidential and never be made public, unless done so by the security team.

[bug automatically created by: add-tracking-bugs]

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1416096,1416101,1416104,1416110,1416114,1416116,1416126,1416128

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for CVE-2017-5547, CVE-2016-10153, CVE-2016-10154, CVE-2017-5548, CVE-2017-5549, CVE-2017-5550, CVE-2017-5551

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

The problem with the ds2490 still exists https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1415397

WFM, Thinkpad X250

- Works great on my Thinkpad X220.
- Kernel regression tests passed.
testing F25 for Cubietruck; everything good so far except wifi. It's not working due to a missing kernel module "pwrseq_simple". Any chance to add this module to the out-of-the-box kernel?

-negative karma  fpaste --sysinfo https://paste.fedoraproject.org/538708/37171148

video doesnt support full resolution and external monitor not found
Works on T450s, Atom based server and a VM, all x86_64. Dunno yet whether that suspend bug with e1000e was fixed on T450s, but it's no worse than 4.9.5.
No regressions on my laptop with AMD E-450 APU
Works for me
Please be aware of the following bugs: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1415339 https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1391987

As an addendum to my earlier karma: I've actually been experiencing intermittent problems where one of my laptops (a Lenovo ThinkPad Edge E531) fails to resume from suspension. This started with the 4.9 kernel series, but I haven't narrowed it down to which one (but it definitely predates 4.9.6). I don't have anything useful to report since the journal records the system suspending and then nothing else. It's not a graphics issue, as the machine fails to respond to pings as well. It appears that it actually fails to completely suspend (USB devices cease to receive power, the screen blanks, the fan turns off, etc., but the power indicator light never starts blinking), and gets stuck in a state it can't get out of. I haven't seen any bug reports that match these particular parameters.
Working fine for me.

This kernel does not fix RHBZ#1415339 (Problem with realtek driver).

Passed kernel regression test on x86_64 machine
And... machine doesn't shutdown properly.

Yeah, I'm also seeing the shutdown problem on a desktop i3 with bios. But not a regression with 4.9.6 for me.
Looks to me, like fixing a similar issue with 4.9 broke other machines, as mine worked fine with 4.8:
https://bugzilla.kernel.org/show_bug.cgi?id=187061

the error ----> [    3.852338] tpm_crb MSFT0101:00: can't request region for resource [mem 0xfed40080-0xfed40fff]

stills persists on the kernel. 
The brightness keys function are now disabled too.
Machine : Asus UX303UA

the error ----> [ 3.852338] tpm_crb MSFT0101:00: can't request region for resource [mem 0xfed40080-0xfed40fff]
stills persists on the kernel. The brightness keys function are now disabled too. Machine : Asus UX303UA

bugs.title: CVE-2017-5576 kernel: vc4: Integer overflow in temporary allocation layout

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-5576 kernel: vc4: Integer overflow in temporary allocation layout

long_desc.thetext:
Integer overflow in the vc4_get_bcl function in drivers/gpu/drm/vc4/vc4_gem.c in the VideoCore DRM driver in the Linux kernel before 4.9.7 allows local users to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted size value in a VC4_SUBMIT_CL ioctl call.

References:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2017/q1/165

Upstream patch:

https://lkml.org/lkml/2017/1/17/761

https://git.kernel.org/cgit/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=0f2ff82e11c86c05d051cae32b58226392d33bbf

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1416439]

Statement:

This issue does not affect the Linux kernel packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, 6, 7 and MRG-2 as the code with the flaw is not present in the products listed.

bugs.title: CVE-2017-5577 kernel: vc4: Heap-buffer overflow due to failing checks

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2017-5577 kernel: vc4: Heap-buffer overflow due to failing checks

long_desc.thetext:
The vc4_get_bcl function in drivers/gpu/drm/vc4/vc4_gem.c in the VideoCore DRM driver in the Linux kernel before 4.9.7 does not set an errno value upon certain overflow detections, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (incorrect pointer dereference and OOPS) via inconsistent size values in a VC4_SUBMIT_CL ioctl call.

References:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2017/q1/165

Upstream patch:

https://lkml.org/lkml/2017/1/17/759

https://git.kernel.org/cgit/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=6b8ac63847bc2f958dd93c09edc941a0118992d9

Created kernel tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1416439]

Statement:

This issue does not affect the Linux kernel packages as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, 6, 7 and MRG-2 as the code with the flaw is not present in the products listed.
